verses.kjv: Then Joseph came and told Pharaoh, and said, My father and my brethren, and their flocks, and their herds, and all that they have, are come out of the land of Canaan; and, behold, they are in the land of Goshen.
verses.ct: Joseph went to Pharaoh and reported, "My father and brothers have arrived from the land of Canaan with their flocks, herds, and everything they own. They are currently in the region of Goshen."

verses.kjv: And he took some of his brethren, even five men, and presented them unto Pharaoh.
verses.ct: He selected 5 of his brothers and introduced them to Pharaoh.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh said unto his brethren, What is your occupation? And they said unto Pharaoh, Thy servants are shepherds, both we, and also our fathers.
verses.ct: Pharaoh asked them, "What do you do for a living?" They answered, "We are shepherds, sir — just as our ancestors were before us."

verses.kjv: They said moreover unto Pharaoh, For to sojourn in the land are we come; for thy servants have no pasture for their flocks; for the famine is sore in the land of Canaan: now therefore, we pray thee, let thy servants dwell in the land of Goshen.
verses.ct: They continued, "We have come to live in this land temporarily, because the famine in Canaan is so severe that there is no pasture left for our flocks. Please allow us to settle in the region of Goshen."

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh spake unto Joseph, saying, Thy father and thy brethren are come unto thee:
verses.ct: Pharaoh said to Joseph, "Your father and brothers have come to you."

verses.kjv: The land of Egypt is before thee; in the best of the land make thy father and brethren to dwell; in the land of Goshen let them dwell: and if thou knowest any men of activity among them, then make them rulers over my cattle.
verses.ct: "The entire land of Egypt is open to you. Settle your father and brothers in the finest part of the country — let them live in Goshen. And if any of them are especially capable, put them in charge of my own livestock."

verses.kjv: And Joseph brought in Jacob his father, and set him before Pharaoh: and Jacob blessed Pharaoh.
verses.ct: Then Joseph brought his father Jacob in and presented him to Pharaoh. Jacob greeted Pharaoh with a blessing.

verses.kjv: And Pharaoh said unto Jacob, How old art thou?
verses.ct: Pharaoh asked Jacob, "How old are you?"

verses.kjv: And Jacob said unto Pharaoh, The days of the years of my pilgrimage are an hundred and thirty years: few and evil have the days of the years of my life been, and have not attained unto the days of the years of the life of my fathers in the days of their pilgrimage.
verses.ct: Jacob replied, "I have wandered this earth for 130 years. My years have been few and difficult, and I haven't lived as long as my ancestors did during their journeys."

verses.kjv: And Jacob blessed Pharaoh, and went out from before Pharaoh.
verses.ct: Jacob blessed Pharaoh again and then left his presence.

verses.kjv: And Joseph placed his father and his brethren, and gave them a possession in the land of Egypt, in the best of the land, in the land of Rameses, as Pharaoh had commanded.
verses.ct: Joseph settled his father and brothers in Egypt, giving them property in the finest part of the land, in the district of Rameses, just as Pharaoh had ordered.

verses.kjv: And Joseph nourished his father, and his brethren, and all his father’s household, with bread, according to their families.
verses.ct: Joseph provided food for his father, his brothers, and everyone in his father's household, according to the size of each family.

verses.kjv: And there was no bread in all the land; for the famine was very sore, so that the land of Egypt and all the land of Canaan fainted by reason of the famine.
verses.ct: There was no food anywhere, because the famine was extremely severe. Both Egypt and Canaan were devastated by it.

verses.kjv: And Joseph gathered up all the money that was found in the land of Egypt, and in the land of Canaan, for the corn which they bought: and Joseph brought the money into Pharaoh’s house.
verses.ct: Joseph collected all the money that could be found in Egypt and Canaan as payment for the grain people purchased, and he brought it all into Pharaoh's treasury.

verses.kjv: And when money failed in the land of Egypt, and in the land of Canaan, all the Egyptians came unto Joseph, and said, Give us bread: for why should we die in thy presence? for the money faileth.
verses.ct: When the money in Egypt and Canaan ran out, all the Egyptians came to Joseph and said, "Give us food! Why should we die right in front of you? Our money is gone."

verses.kjv: And Joseph said, Give your cattle; and I will give you for your cattle, if money fail.
verses.ct: Joseph told them, "Bring your livestock, and I will trade you food for them, since your money is gone."

verses.kjv: And they brought their cattle unto Joseph: and Joseph gave them bread in exchange for horses, and for the flocks, and for the cattle of the herds, and for the asses: and he fed them with bread for all their cattle for that year.
verses.ct: So they brought their livestock to Joseph, and he gave them food in exchange for their horses, flocks, cattle, and donkeys. He supplied them with food for all their livestock that year.

verses.kjv: When that year was ended, they came unto him the second year, and said unto him, We will not hide it from my lord, how that our money is spent; my lord also hath our herds of cattle; there is not ought left in the sight of my lord, but our bodies, and our lands:
verses.ct: When that year was over, they came back the next year and told him, "We won't hide the truth from you, sir — our money is completely gone, and you already have our livestock. We have nothing left to offer except our bodies and our land."

verses.kjv: Wherefore shall we die before thine eyes, both we and our land? buy us and our land for bread, and we and our land will be servants unto Pharaoh: and give us seed, that we may live, and not die, that the land be not desolate.
verses.ct: "Why should we die while you watch — both us and our farmland? Buy us and our land in exchange for food, and we will serve Pharaoh as his servants. Just give us seed so we can survive and not starve, and so the land won't become a wasteland."

verses.kjv: And Joseph bought all the land of Egypt for Pharaoh; for the Egyptians sold every man his field, because the famine prevailed over them: so the land became Pharaoh’s.
verses.ct: So Joseph purchased all the farmland in Egypt for Pharaoh. Every Egyptian sold their fields because the famine was too much for them, and the land became Pharaoh's property.

verses.kjv: And as for the people, he removed them to cities from one end of the borders of Egypt even to the other end thereof.
verses.ct: As for the people, he relocated them into the cities from one end of Egypt to the other.

verses.kjv: Only the land of the priests bought he not; for the priests had a portion assigned them of Pharaoh, and did eat their portion which Pharaoh gave them: wherefore they sold not their lands.
verses.ct: The only land he did not buy was the land belonging to the priests, because they received a regular allowance from Pharaoh and lived off what Pharaoh provided them. That is why they did not have to sell their land.

verses.kjv: Then Joseph said unto the people, Behold, I have bought you this day and your land for Pharaoh: lo, here is seed for you, and ye shall sow the land.
verses.ct: Then Joseph told the people, "Today I have purchased you and your land for Pharaoh. Here is seed for you — go and plant your fields."

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in the increase, that ye shall give the fifth part unto Pharaoh, and four parts shall be your own, for seed of the field, and for your food, and for them of your households, and for food for your little ones.
verses.ct: "At harvest time, you must give a 5th of your crop to Pharaoh. The other 4 parts are yours — for planting seed, for feeding yourselves, your households, and your children."

verses.kjv: And they said, Thou hast saved our lives: let us find grace in the sight of my lord, and we will be Pharaoh’s servants.
verses.ct: They responded, "You have saved our lives! If it pleases you, sir, we will gladly serve as Pharaoh's servants."

verses.kjv: And Joseph made it a law over the land of Egypt unto this day, that Pharaoh should have the fifth part; except the land of the priests only, which became not Pharaoh’s.
verses.ct: Joseph established it as a law throughout Egypt — still in effect to this day — that a 5th of all produce belongs to Pharaoh. Only the priests' land was exempt and never became Pharaoh's property.

verses.kjv: And Israel dwelt in the land of Egypt, in the country of Goshen; and they had possessions therein, and grew, and multiplied exceedingly.
verses.ct: Israel settled in Egypt, in the region of Goshen. They acquired property there and were fruitful, growing greatly in number.

verses.kjv: And Jacob lived in the land of Egypt seventeen years: so the whole age of Jacob was an hundred forty and seven years.
verses.ct: Jacob lived in Egypt for 17 years, so his total lifespan was 147 years.

verses.kjv: And the time drew nigh that Israel must die: and he called his son Joseph, and said unto him, If now I have found grace in thy sight, put, I pray thee, thy hand under my thigh, and deal kindly and truly with me; bury me not, I pray thee, in Egypt:
verses.ct: When the time of Israel's death drew near, he called for his son Joseph and said to him, "If I have earned your trust, please place your hand under my thigh and promise to show me faithful loyalty: do not bury me in Egypt."

verses.kjv: But I will lie with my fathers, and thou shalt carry me out of Egypt, and bury me in their buryingplace. And he said, I will do as thou hast said.
verses.ct: "Instead, when I join my ancestors, carry me out of Egypt and bury me where they are buried." Joseph answered, "I will do what you've asked."

verses.kjv: And he said, Swear unto me. And he sware unto him. And Israel bowed himself upon the bed’s head.
verses.ct: Jacob said, "Swear it to me." So Joseph swore an oath to him. Then Israel bowed his head at the top of his bed.
